results.title: 'Victory girls', Albert Tucker, 1943
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Australian National Gallery and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “The Australian eye”.
An examination of some of the powerful and disturbing paintings of Albert Tucker. Talks of the influence wartime Melbourne had on his work which is reflected in “Victory girls”. Also describes the way in which one particular obsessive image, the crescent shape, found in “Victory girls” emerged to take over the design of a number of his works. Narrated by Albert Tucker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Australian National Gallery and Film Australia

results.title: 'The Lacquer room' by Grace Cossington Smith
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Australian eye II”.
Painted in mid-career, “The Lacquer room” shows Grace Cossington Smith’s mature, Cezanne-influenced style and demonstrates her instinctive ability to bring forms up to a frontal plane in Post-Impressionist rejection of traditional perspective.

results.title: 'Study for 'Dog gymkahna'' by Frank Hinder, 1938
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Australian eye II”.
A study of the oil painting by Frank Hinder, “Study for dog gymkhana”. One of a handful of paintings which carried Australian art beyond Post-Impressionism into Cubism and its off-shoots. Commentary by Cecily Poulson.

results.title: 'Rockthorpe' Tasmania.
results.brief_description: The story of the production of breeding ewes and rams required to maintain high quality Australian wool. Fifty years of experience at “Rockthorpe” stud farm in Tasmania, have produced the Polwarth sheep - a breed suited to both coastal and highland conditions. Shows how the use of a fleec measurement system, individual classification, and selection of breeding-stock brings outstanding results.

results.title: Computer Games, Mi Sex
results.brief_description: Video clip for “Computer Games” (1979) by New Zealand band, Mi-Sex.

constellations_other.name: Beyond the game industry
constellations_other.description: While the game industry garners a lot of publicity, digital games have long been created outside the official industry, and the social and cultural significance of games has always exceeded official channels.

results.title: Titles in Analects of Kung Phu
results.description:
Aside from bareknuckle action and breakneck stunts, martial arts and wuxia films are packed with wisdom and life lessons. Artist Jason Phu has reclaimed these wise sayings and remixed them into a moving image philosophy for surviving contemporary life. Divided into chapters featuring insights and meditations from different movies, TV shows and videogames, Analects of Kung Phu: Book 1, The 69 Dialogues between the Lamp and the Shadow offers a guide to ourselves and society taught by action stars and movie heroes.

This list corresponds to the different channels in the work, with the main middle screen represented on the left and the two secondary screens, titled ‘Horse’ and ‘Bird’ to the right.

results.title: Hades

constellations_other.name: Iconic creative partnerships
constellations_other.description: Actor Nicholas Hoult and writer-director Tony Mcnamara worked on The Favourite together before Hoult was cast in The Great. Strong creative partnerships between particular actors and directors are the backbone of screen creativity.

results.description: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.
description_for_label: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.

results.title: Collective
results.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania which kills dozens.
description_for_label: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania which kills dozens.
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.credit_line:
Charli XCX & Troye Sivan

Creative Direction: WP&A

Executive Producer: Ryen Bartlett

Warner Music Group
results.brief_description:
The official music video for Charli XCX & Troye Sivan - “1999”.

Taken from the third studio album Charli, released in 2019. Charli featured the singles “1999”, “Blame It On Your Love”, “Gone” and “White Mercedes.”

constellations_other.name: Faking history
constellations_other.description: The Great takes a creative approach to its historical characters and settings that is mirrored in its costumes - this war dress might have a classic silhouette, but the grimy pearlescent fabric and striking oxblood detailing is completely modern. Faking history is a time-honoured tradition in film, from historical fiction to propaganda.

results.creator_credit_for_label:
Charli XCX & Troye Sivan

Creative Direction: WP&A

Executive Producer: Ryen Bartlett

Warner Music Group

description_for_label:
The official music video for Charli XCX & Troye Sivan - “1999”.

Taken from the third studio album Charli, released in 2019. Charli featured the singles “1999”, “Blame It On Your Love”, “Gone” and “White Mercedes.”
results.credit_line_for_label:
Charli XCX & Troye Sivan

Creative Direction: WP&A

Executive Producer: Ryen Bartlett

Warner Music Group

results.title: Maps Against the World (2016)
results.credit_line:
Director: Woo-Suk Kang

Writers: Jung-mi Choi (screenplay); Beom-shin Park (novel)

Starring: Seung-Won Cha; Shin Dong-mi; Kim In-kwon
results.brief_description: Director Woo-Suk Kang’s 2016 documentary tells the story of the real cartographer Kim Jeong-Ho who mapped the islands of Korea in the nineteenth century. In a period when only royalty and governments held the knowledge held in maps, Jeong-Ho wanted to make maps to empower ordinary Koreans to mark their land and to travel safely. Maps embody knowledge, in stories and beyond.

constellations_other.name: The narrative power of maps
constellations_other.description: Maps are designed to communicate complex information in a clear manner to aid both navigation and wayfinding and knowledge of place.

results.description: Director Woo-Suk Kang’s 2016 film tells the true story of the 19th century cartographer Kim Jeong-Ho, who mapped the islands of Korea. In a period when only royalty and governments held the knowledge held in maps, Jeong-Ho wanted to make maps to empower ordinary Koreans to mark their land and to travel safely. Maps embody knowledge, in stories and beyond.
